Kvalifikacije za OI: Posle Srbije i Hrvatska podnela kandidaturu
05 Nov 2019, 14:35 by Zile
Hrvatski košarkaški savez potvrdio je u utorak da je podneo zvaničnu kandidaturu za organizaciju jednog od četiri kvalifikaciona turnira za odlazak na Olimpijske igre u Tokiju.
Savez je kao organizatora predložio Split i „Spaladium Arenu“ prvenstveno zbog navijača i ambijenta.
Turnir bi trebalo da bude održan od 23. do 28. juna sledeće godine, a kako su preneli hrvatski mediji domaćinstvo je zvanično podržano od strane Vlade Hrvatske.
FIBA će odrediti domaćine turnira 15. novembra, a pored Srbije i Hrvatske potencijalni organizatori su Kanada, Poljska i Litvanija.
Za organizaciju turnira bilo je potrebno priložiti novčanu garanciju od 3 miliona evra, od čega 2.3 miliona ide na račun FIBA kao kotizacija za ovaj turnir, a preostalih 700.000 ide na troškove organizacije.

Qualifying for the Olympics: After Serbia and Croatia applied
05 Nov 2019, 13:35 by Zile
The Croatian Basketball Federation confirmed on Tuesday that it has formally applied to organize one of four qualifying tournaments for the Tokyo Olympics.
The association proposed Split and Spaladium Arena as the organizers, primarily because of the fans and ambience.
The tournament is scheduled to take place from 23 to 28 June next year, and as reported by the Croatian media, the household is officially supported by the Croatian Government.
FIBA is set to host the tournament on November 15, with potential organizers Canada, Poland and Lithuania in addition to Serbia and Croatia.
The organization of the tournament required a cash guarantee of 3 million euros, of which 2.3 million goes to the FIBA account as a registration fee for this tournament, and the remaining 700,000 goes to the organization's expenses.
